Ways to avoid PKers:

   1. Have an uber lvl 40 build.
   2. You can expect a lvl 40 playerkiller is hunting you when in an area where you level suddenly monsters with a higher CR spawn.
      If this happens: run to next area and port to a town or bindstone, or use some portals in the area where you level and when you see a pk is approaching then use a portal. Cast the portals at several places in the area. So you have a higher chance of escape. And you can port back when the pk is gone.
   3. DO NOT speak on shout channel where you level. DO NOT speak on shout channel where you want to go. DO NOT speak on talk channel in a city where you want to go.
   4. Join a faction who can offer you protection from pk.
   5. Level in a big party. Higher chance that someone else gets pked. and then... run.
   6. Remember the Names of playerkillers. So if asked for invite ask a mate if he knows the guy who wants an invitation.
   7. Dont go back to a place where playerkillers are camping around. Search for another level spot.
   8. Don't send disrespectful comments towards someone who just killed you. Its pvp here. Accept it. Or they will hunt you down and kill you again (Sometimes^^).
INFO: Avoiding PK's

Character Value Rating (CVR here-after) is a base value rating used in Player vs. Player (PvP here-after) fame reward calculations. 

A characters Base CVR begins at 1.00 and is modified by character classes as follows: 

+0.15 for 10 or more Sorcerer/Wizard levels and an additional +0.15 with 17 or more levels. 
+0.20 for 17 or more Cleric levels. 
+0.10 for 5 or more Druid levels and an additional +0.15 if pure. 
+0.05 for any Dragon, Construct or Outsider feat. 
+0.01 for every 3 Monk levels, additionally this is tripled if AA levels are taken and this is also multiplied by 6 if the characters strength is above 24. 

+0.05 for 10 or more Palemaster levels. 
+0.10 for a Pure (level 40) Barbarian. 
+0.03 for Shadow Dancer. 
+0.10 for 20 Bard levels and an additional +0.02 every 5 levels thereafter.
INFO: Character Value Rating

Faction Tags: 

A faction tag is a short abbreviation placed on the beginning or end of a character name denoting a faction. (IE: Doom the Hedgehog GoD) ("GoD" being the tag). 

It is the policy of DeX that the Faction you join will determine if a Faction Tag is Required. 

BE WARNED: You are not allowed to play a Faction Tagged character if you are not a member of that designated faction. All such tagged characters must be turned in for xp or deleted upon leaving a faction requiring tags. So choose a faction well. 

Current DEX Factions: 

Lost Souls 
Chaotic Neutral 
General - Vox 

Empire
Lawful Neutral 
General - Hexis (lolthatguy) 

Order of the Holy Light 
Chaotic Good 
General - Vengeance 

Dark Legion 
Chaotic Evil 
General - SilentHunter111
INFO: DeX Factions

- The following item properties are not allowed: All Immunities, Damage Reduction, Damage Resistance, AC Bonus greater than +5, Enhancement or Attack Bonus greater than +5, True Seeing, Freedom of Movement, Holy Avenger, Feats & Abilities, Versus Alignment Group (AC Bonus, Enchantment Bonus, Attack Bonus, Damage Bonus), and Containers (Weight Reduction or otherwise). There are, however, some items that cast spells with these properties. 

- Damage bonuses up to 2d12

- Large weapons allow any combination of 36 damage bonus (i.e. 3x2d6, 2d12+2d6, etc), medium and small allow 24 damage bonus (i.e. 2d12, 2x2d6), monk gloves allow 36 (i.e. 3x2d6, 2d12+2d6, etc), and arrows allow 12 damage donus (i.e 2d6)

- Weapons are allowed a single OnHit property

- Stats on items will be limited to +8 on every item (any combo)

- Skillpoints can be put on items to a max of +4 on each item (any combo)

- Saving throws can be added in the following manner: +3 vs. effects (any combo) OR +5 fort/refl/will (any combo)

- Fortitude saving throws will incur a penalty vs. death effect. Saving throw bonuses vs. effects do not incur any penalties.

- The following item properties MAY NOT BE COMBINED on a single item: On Hit, Ability Bonus, Skill Bonus, Improved Saving Throw, Bonus Spell Slot, and Regeneration.

- Ability, save, skill and regeneration on throwing weapons is NOT allowed
INFO: Item Rules

When a player kills certain number of other player successively without dying or the server resetting, he is granted neat bonuses depending on the number of players killed. Do note that players over 25 levels lower do not count towards your spree.

The following bonuses are granted:
- 10 kills: 50% concealment vs. ranged attacks
- 15 kills: 30% concealment
- 20 kills: 25/+20 damage reduction
- 25 kills: 2d6+25 damage shield
- 30 kills: KD Immunity
- 35 kills: Critical hit immunity

All of the bonuses stack and are persistent until the player in question rests or is killed. Logging out will no reset your kill count but beware that logging out to avoid losing your spree, or to avoid your spree count to be reset is strictly forbidden and all offense will be severely punished.
INFO: Killing Spree Regulations

Hello and welcome to DeX. 

We are glad that you are choose to join us and would like to start you off on the right foot. 
Join us on Discord at Discord.DungeonEternalX.com

The Rules of DeX are can be found in a rulebook placed in your inventory at character creation. Please view it to understand our do's and don'ts. You should also review the rules concerning items, these can be found via a journal entry 

To Get Started: 

You should 1st visit the Library/Sub-race Showroom in the Loftenwood Tavern and review the changes for individual classes there. Talk to "Aleck". While you're there you can also get a peak at all of our available sub races. You do not have to pick a Sub-race on DeX but it is always fun to try them. 

Going back upstairs to the Tavern you can find a man that sells free armor for lvl 1 characters, his name is Celebrimbor. I'd suggest you take advantage of this to get some starting equipment to help you in the beginning. But if you're a vet or just a hard core player, you can head directly into town to craft your own. 

Get familiar with your Loftenwood crystal. One has been provided for you in your inventory. All city crystals port you to a central location within the city. 
Crystals for all of the following cities can be found: 

Loftenwood 
Meneldur 
Ridgetown 
Tanglebrook 
Kjuiana Sands 
Duvanbawer 

Visit the bank and see how you can store items in a chest and use the teller to store money and experience points. 
Also note. at the back of the bank there is a vault with extremely hard monsters to get through but if you do you can rob the bank. 

In the magic store in any city you may find potions and scrolls to assist you in leveling as well. You may also find portal stones, class tokens, animosity tokens, and a few other goodies in either the magic store or general store of every city. 

Visit Baba Yaga real fast and give yourself some buffs . We like to have the leveling process be fairly easy at level one and the weapon buffs and ability buffs in baba's are there for that purpose. 

That should be all you need to begin your leveling process. At the beginning you can go North out of Loftenwood for the graveyards level 1, south for pond level 1, west for goblins level 1, and east for the marshes. ENJOY!!!
INFO: New to DeX? Read This.

Please read: "Rule Book" currently in your inventory, or available for purchase at Loftenwood - General Shop.
Please also read the Journal Entry Item Rules for information about weapon rules on DeX.

Using any warlord gear is not allowed on a non-warlord.
INFO: Rules of Dungeon Eternal X

A Sub-Race is an additional option on DEX.  A sub-race can be used to swap around some basic stats, or perhaps to add a needed feat.  Each sub-race has both benefits and detriments, so choose wisely. 

Creating a sub-race on DEX is very easy to do. During character creation, when selecting your characters RACE* (Elf, Dwarf, etc), simply type the exact name shown below into the sub-race field (bottom box on RACE selection page) and then press ok, then continue with character creation. 

(*Note some sub-races require a specific base race to be selected, just select the race as normal before typing in the sub-race syntax)
 
When you are done creating your character and log into DEX, we will check this field. If you have meet all the sub-race's listed requirements DEX will apply your desired sub-race and then force you to relog by killing you without a re-spawn option. 

Aasimar
Darkelf
Kobold
Tiefling
Ettin
Seahag
Ogre
Azer
Duergar
Avariel
Drow
Dopkalfar
Ljosalfar
Svirfneblin
Gnoll
ArcticDwarf

November 19th Editions: Type the name as it appears in subrace menu
EarthGenasi
WaterGenasi
MountainOrc
Ondonti
RockGnome
DeepGnome


More information about the sub-race can be found in the basement Library located in Loftenwood Tavern. 

*Note, at times multiple skins (they look like a spread out animal skin) may appear in your characters inventory. To help keep your inventory un-cluttered, a destroyer tool is auto provided for your use. Simply use it and point at your extra skins. *BE SURE TO KEEP ATLEAST ONE SKIN, DO NOT DELETE THEM ALL.
INFO: Subrace

Players can use the follwing commands to gain further control of their SUMMONED creature.

/sum nme NAME 
-This command will rename the summon to NAME

/sum att
-This command will force the summon to attack the current hostile target of the PC.
INFO: Summon Commands

MISSION 01: Kill the Scouts

Contractee: Nadia the town healer
Task: Kill 1 Champion

There are apparently exceptionally powerful creatures plaguing the lands outside town. Nadia wants me to put them back in their place before they spread even further. I have to perform the killing blow though - for some reason simply being there when one gets killed isn't enough.
Mission succeeded
Mission failed

Contractee: Nadia the town healer
Task: Kill 1 Champion

So one wannabe champion down - that just goes to show who the real champion here is... I should tell Nadia of my heroic deeds and collect my reward.
MISSION 02: Kill a Champion

Contractee: Stonehead the great goblin
Task: Help Stonehead fighting the Dryads

Stonehead has sent me a message in which he babbled something about Dryads who were plotting against the coming goblin world domination. He says I should help the goblins in order to be spared when Maglubiyet awakens.
Mission succeeded
Mission failed

Contractee: Stonehead the great goblin
Task: Help Stonehead fighting the Dryads

Sorted. I went with the goblins to the Dryads' and fought Epimeliad of Enchassara, although it appeared as though the goblins showed a greater interest in silver than in the outcome of the fight. I shall still collect my reward though as Stonehead should be pleased.
MISSION 03: Help Stonehead

Mission failed

Contractee: Epimeliad of Enchassara
Task: find the Maglubiyet statue and destroy it

The dryad leader suspects a connection between a statue of Maglubiyet and a tunnel which the goblins are digging in their (the dryads') direction. She has given me the mission of finding and destroying the statue instead of finding something out about it. This is probably caused by her distrust of others.
Mission succeeded
Mission failed

Contractee: Epimeliad of Enchassara
Task: find the Maglubiyet statue and destroy it

I have destroyed the statue but have the feeling as though I have not really helped the Dryads. Then again they wanted it this way and I have earned my reward.
MISSION 06: Maglubiyet Statue

Cthaur wants me to destroy shadows - that is all I need to know apparently and must not ask any questions. I wonder why he concerns himself with shadows in such an obscure region. These creatures do not really tend to leave the places they haunt.

Contractee: Cthaur
Task: Kill 10 Nekrosis Shadows (1 left)

Contractee: Cthaur

I have killed the required number of shadows - Cthaur should be pleased. I think that this region is more important to Cthaur than he lets on... though I have completed my mission and need to go to him about it.
MISSION 07: Kill Shadows

Contractee: Aislinn, acolyte of Adaghar
Task: destroy a faction obelisk

For some reason Aislinn has an interest in warring factions. In order to fan the flames I need to destroy a obelisk and as long as I get something out of it I am IN.
Mission succeeded
Mission failed

Task: destroy a faction obelisk

Well that has been done; I should go to Aislinn and pick up my reward.
MISSION 08: Faction Obelisks

Contractee: Cerali
Task: Find a Fame Trophy

Cerali is currently working on a device that can detect fame trophies. It cannot detect anything at the moment but does emit a signal of some kind whenever someone picks a trophy up. He has asked me to keep an eye out for these trophies so that he can continue his work and examine it when it next goes off.
Mission succeeded
Mission failed

Contractee: Cerali
Task: Find a Fame Trophy

I have finally found a trophy and hope that Cerali's instrument worked. I should go and collect my dues.
MISSION 09: Fame Trophy

Contractee: Bank Teller
Task: Donate a level 15 character

The bank is doing a study on the speed with which one can gain experience points. In order to help I should donate a level fifteen character. It seems to me as though this study is more of a rough one as there are no conditions regarding how one actually gets the experience points - one simply needs a level fifteen character.
Mission succeeded
Mission failed

Contractee: Bank Teller
Task: Donate a level 15 character

I have donated a level fifteen - the clerk didn't ask how I got the experience. Now to collect my reward...
MISSION 10: Donate XP for Fame

Snirble made me a special offer - if I get three stars in his game I win a prize. Having enough time for a game or two I agreed.
